ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I really learned how to write. I can write better than I ever have.
I learned the ability to write a creative modern essay. I found new skills to implement in my learning, while reinforcing basics. I read many famous authors and essays.
we read notable essayists and looked at their technical approaches to see what we could implement in our own essays.
I learned many moves of the personal essaythat is to say, I learned techniques for writing personal nonfiction through reading the techniques in famous pieces.
How to write well, how to use language to articulate my points, how to organize an essay and write clearly and concisely.

I improved a lot on my personal essay writing and felt that the skills I developed in this class not only made me a bitter personal essay writer, but a better writer overall and I think these skills can be applied well in many different ways.
This class really improved my writing!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: readings were incredible, and the essays were always fun to write. Ms. Jones was really the gem of the class. Probably my favorite instructor yet and really made the class a great time. 

Weakness: can't think of any honestly

I think a little less reading at times so that we can focus on few essays and dive deeper into them. The strengths are the creativity required in the course and the open space to be completely vulnerable and feel welcome.  One of the biggest strengths of this course is the ability to turn in drafts before final entry because it enhances the essay so much.

i enjoyed participation in this course and I enjoyed many of the essays and writers we were able to read. a weakness is that at times the prompts (or at least my professors interpretations of them) felt limiting, as though if we did not write the essay as she wanted it written there would be more negative feedback rather than having the prompts as loose guidelines to help us generate ideas. i wish that we could've written more and that we could've gotten feedback from peers in person on almost everything we wrote. i think having more prompts to choose from could've been more exciting/engaging.
The strengths of this course are the feedback and the engagement with readings.

I think that this course is different depending on who teaches it so Im only speaking for my class when I say we had a lot of homework. This was sometimes a good thing because it forced me to work hard but sometimes if I was really busy I would skip it entirely or not give it my full attention so I could just get it done. If there was less homework I may have been able to focus more on it.

The course was organized very well and the flow of the semester was quite good. Additionally, the essays selected by my teacher were very good and used many interesting techniques that I had not appreciated fully until we discussed them in class.
This class has a lot of work, but it is very beneficial.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES YES YES! But only with Ms. Jones. I'm biased, I know. She was really just the best and made the course so amazing. Having a great instructor for a class like this makes all the difference. The readings she chose were so fun to read and were from a range of timelines, from early in American history to today. The grading can be stiff but honestly just put in the work for the class and you'll get a grade that reflects it.

I would definitely recommend this course to students who want to explore their writing in a less traditional and strict way. You learn about yourself through your writing and also learn how to write a good essay.

definitely would recommend. it's one of those yale classes everyone should take; but ideally and hopefully you'll feel compatible with all your classmates so that you each can get out more of what you put into it. i wish that everyone in my class cared just a bit more or seemed more passionate and opinionated, but the group was still fun.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. It was a pleasure to read and write with my professor and peers!
Yes. It improved my writing skills dramatically.
I would recommend this course to any student independent of their major or interests. The foundations built in the course are widely applicable and the material is interesting and engaging.
Yes, it is a great class
